hillbillies.model.unit

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.unit.Unit

  • public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    The unit class, this class keeps tracks of the unit's position, speed and other attributes. It provides methods to move, to attack and to rest.
    Invariants:
  • The position of the unit must be valid.
        isValidPosition(this.getPosition())
  • The orientation fof the unit must be valid.
        isValidOrientation(this.getOrientation())
  • The weight of the unit must be valid.
        canHaveAsWeight(this.getWeight())
  • The Strength of the unit must be valid.
        isValidStrength(this.getStrength())
  • The Agility of the unit must be valid.
        isValidAgility(this.getAgility())
  • The Toughness of the unit must be valid.
        isValidToughness(this.getToughness())
  • The HitPoints must be valid.
        canHaveAsHitPoints(this.getHitPoints())
  • The stamina must be valid.
        canHaveAsStamina(this.getStamina())
  • The unit must always be in a faction if the world is effective.
        if (getWorld() != null)
          then (getFaction != null)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Unit

        @Raw
public Unit(java.lang.String name,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int z,
                 int weight,
                 int strength,
                 int agility,
                 int toughness)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 InvalidPositionException
        Creates a new unit with the given position and attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new unit.
        x - The initial x value of the position.
        y - The initial y value of the position.
        z - The initial z value of the position.
        weight - The initial weight of the unit.
        strength - The initial strength of the unit.
        agility - The initial agility of the unit.
        toughness - The initial toughness of the unit.
        Postcondition:
        Sets the hit points to their maximum value.
            new.getHitPoints() == new.getMaxPoints()
            && new.getStamina() == new.getMaxPoints()
        Effects:
      • Set the name to the given name.
            new.setName(name)
      • Set the position to the middle of the given block.
            new.setPosition(new Vector(x + Lc/2, y + Lc/2, z + Lc/2))
      • Sets the orientation to 90 degrees.
            new.setOrientation(Unit.INIT_ORIENTATION)
      • Sets the toughness to toughness clamped between 25 and 100
            new.setToughness(Util.clamp(toughness, 25, 100))
      • Sets the agility to agility clamped between 25 and 100
            new.setAgility(Util.clamp(agility, 25, 100))
      • Sets the weight to weight clamped between 25 and 100
            new.setWeight(Util.clamp(weight, 25, 100))
      • Sets the strength to strength clamped between 25 and 100
            new.setStrength(Util.clamp(strength, 25, 100))
      • Resets the XP.
            new.resetXp()
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        InvalidPositionException

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminates the current unit.
        Postconditions:
      • The unit is not doing any activities.
            !isMoving() && !isWorking() && !isResting() && !isAttacking()
      • The unit's hit points will be 0.
            new.getHitPoints() == 0
      • The unit is not alive.
            new.isAlive() == false
      • The unit is removed from the world.
            !this.getWorld().getUnits().contains(this)
      • The unit's world will be set to null
            new.getWorld() == null
        • Effects:
      • Stop the task the unit is running, if applicable.
            if (this.hasAssignedTask()) then this.getAssignedTask().interrupt()
      • If the unit is carrying an item, drop it.
            if (this.isCarryingBoulder() || this.isCarryingLog())
              this.dropCarry(this.getPosition().toIntVector())

        @Raw
public void setWorld(World world)
        Sets the world of the unit.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to which the unit is added.
        Postcondition:
        The unit's world will be set to the given world.
            new.getWorld() == world

      • advanceTime

        public void advanceTime(double dt)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Updates the units state.
        Parameters:
        dt - The time step taken between frames.
        Postconditions:
      • We also check if three minutes have past, if so we start resting and reset this timer.
      • If the unit is not standing on a passable position, the unit falls. Falling moves the unit down with the falling speed, if the new position is above a solid cube or the world ground, the unit will take damage equal to 10 times the amount off cubes he has traveled. Else the unit will keep falling and his position will be set to the new position.
        • Effect:
        Calls the advanceTime() of the current activity.
            this.getCurrentActivity().advanceTime()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given time step was to big or negative.

      • getCurrentActivity

        @Basic
 @Model
Activity getCurrentActivity()
        Returns the current activity.

      • setCurrentActivity

        @Model
void setCurrentActivity(Activity newActivity)
        Set the current activity.
        Parameters:
        newActivity - The new Activity
        Postcondition:
        The new Activity will be set
            new.getCurrentActivity() == newActivity

      • finishCurrentActivity

        void finishCurrentActivity()
        Finishes the current activity.
        Effects:
      • Marks the unit's tracker done, if it has one.
            if (this.hasTracker()) then (this.getTracker().setDone() && this.setTracker(null))
      • Resets the currentActivity.
            this.getCurrentActivity().reset()
      • If the moveActivity was interrupted, continue moving otherwise stop doing anything.
            if ( this.getMoveActivity().getTarget() != null) then (this.setCurrentActivity(this.getMoveActivity()) )
            else ( this.setCurrentActivity(this.getNoneActivity()) )

      • isStablePosition

        public static boolean isStablePosition(World world,
                                       IntVector cube)
        Check whether the cube is a stable position for unit's to be at. If the unit isn't on a stable position it will fall.
        Parameters:
        cube - The cube to check.
        Returns:
        True if the cube is next to a border of the world or if it has any solid neighbours.
            result == (cube.getX() == 0 || cube.getX() == world.getTerrain().getMaxX() - 1 ||
                       cube.getY() == 0 || cube.getY() == world.getTerrain().getMaxY() - 1 ||
                       cube.getZ() == 0 || cube.getZ() == world.getTerrain().getMaxX() - 1 ||
                       Terrain.getNeighbours(cube).anyMatch(p -> World.isSolid(world.getCubeType(p))))

      • isStablePosition

        public boolean isStablePosition(IntVector cube)
        Check whether the cube is a stable position for unit's to be at.
        Parameters:
        cube - The cube to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the position is stable in the current world.
            result == Unit.isStablePosition(this.getWorld(), cube)

      • isValidPosition

        public static boolean isValidPosition(World world,
                                      IntVector cubePos)
        Checks whether the given position is a valid position for the unit to be at.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to check in.
        cubePos - The position to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the given position is within the boundaries of the world and if it is not solid or if the world is null.
            result == (world == null)
                      || ((world.isValidPosition(cubePos))
                          && (!Terrain.isSolid(world.getTerrain().getCubeType(cubePos)))

      • isValidPosition

        Parameters:
        pos - The position to be checked.
        Returns:
        Check if the position is valid in the current world.
            result == Unit.isValidPosition(this.getWorld(), pos)

      • canHaveAsWeight

        public boolean canHaveAsWeight(int weight)
        Returns whether or not the weight is valid. (only used in class invariant)
        Parameters:
        weight - The weight to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the weight is larger or equal to MIN_ATTRIBUTE, larger or equal to (strength + agility)/2, smaller or equal to MAX_ATTRIBUTE.
            result ==  (weight >= MIN_ATTRIBUTE) && (weight <= MAX_ATTRIBUTE) && (weight >= (getAgility()+getStrength())/2)

      • getWeight

        public int getWeight()
        Returns the weight of the unit with carry weight included.
        Returns:
        Returns the total weight of the unit.
            result == getBasicWeight() + getCarryWeight()

      • setWeight

        @Model
 @Raw
public void setWeight(int weight)
        Sets the units weight to the new weight.
        Parameters:
        weight - The new weight.
        Postcondition:
        The new weight is weight clamped between (strength + agility / 2) and MAX_ATTRIBUTE
            new.getBasicWeight() == Util.clamp(((this.getStrength() + this.getAgility()) / 2), MAX_ATTRIBUTE)

      • isValidAttribute

        public static boolean isValidAttribute(int attribute)
        Checks whether the attribute is valid. (only used in class invariant)
        Parameters:
        attribute - The strength to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the attribute is larger or equal to MIN_ATTRIBUTE and smaller or equal to MAX_ATTRIBUTE.
            result == strength <= MAX_ATTRIBUTE && strength >= MIN_ATTRIBUTE

        @Raw
public void setStrength(int strength)

        Parameters:

        Postcondition:
        The strength is set to strength clamped between MIN_ATTRIBUTE and MAX_ATTRIBUTE.
            new.getStrength() == Util.clamp(strength, MIN_ATTRIBUTE, MAX_ATTRIBUTE);
        Effect:
        The weight is corrected.
            this.setWeight(this.getBasicWeight())

        Effect:
        The weight is corrected.

      • canHaveAsHitPoints

        public boolean canHaveAsHitPoints(int hitPoints)
        Returns whether the hitPoints are valid.
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - The hit points to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the hitPoints are larger than or equal to 0 and smaller than or equal to the maximum amount of hitPoints.
            result == (hitPoints <= getMaxPoints()) && (hitPoints >= 0)

      • getHitPoints

        @Basic
public int getHitPoints()
        Returns the current amount of hitPoints of the unit

      • setHitPoints

        @Raw
 @Model
void setHitPoints(int hitPoints)
        Sets the current hitPoints to the given amount of hitPoints.
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - The new hitPoints of the unit.
        Precondition:
        The hitPoints must be greater or equal than 0 and smaller or equal than max hitPoints.
            (hitPoints <= getMaxPoints()) && (hitPoints >= 0)
        Postcondition:
        The new hitPoints equal the given hitPoints.
            new.getHitPoints() == hitPoints

      • deduceHitPoints

        @Model
void deduceHitPoints(int hitPoints)
        Deduces the given amount hit points from the unit's hp.
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - The Amount of hit points to be deduced.
        Postcondition:
        The unit's new hp shall be equal to the its old hp deduced by the given hitPoints or zero if the new hp would otherwise be negative
            if ( (old.getHitPoints() - hitPoints) > 0 )
              then new.getHitPoints ()== old.getHitPoints() - hitPoints
            else
              this.terminate()
        Effect:
        If the units hp hits 0 or goes below zero the unit will be terminated
            this.terminate()

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Returns whether the unit is alive.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the unit's hp is greater than 0.
            result == this.getHitPoints() > 0

      • canHaveAsStamina

        Returns whether the stamina is valid.
        Parameters:
        stamina - The stamina to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the amount of stamina is larger than or equal to 0 and smaller than or equal to the maximum amount of hitPoints.
            result == (stamina <= getMaxPoints()) && (stamina >= 0)

        @Raw
 @Model
void setStamina(int stamina)
        Sets the current amount of stamina to the given stamina.
        Parameters:
        stamina - The new amount of stamina of the unit
        Precondition:
        The stamina must be greater or equal than 0 and smaller or equal than max stamina
            (stamina <= getMaxPoints()) && (stamina >= 0)
        Postcondition:
        The new stamina equals the given stamina.
            new.getStamina() == stamina

      • getMaxPoints

        public int getMaxPoints()
        Return the maximum amount of hitPoints and stamina.
        Returns:
        Returns 200*(weight/100)*(toughness/100) as an integer
            result == ceil(200*weight*toughness/10000)

      • isValidOrientation

        public static boolean isValidOrientation(double orientation)
        Returns whether the orientation is valid. (only used in class invariant)
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the orientation is equal to or larger than 0 and smaller than 2*PI.
            result == (orientation < 2*Math.PI) && (orientation >= 0)

      • getOrientation

        @Basic
public double getOrientation()
        Returns the current orientation.

      • setOrientation

        @Raw
 @Model
void setOrientation(double orientation)
        Sets the orientation of the unit.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The new orientation.
        Postcondition:
        The new orientation is the same as the old orientation but between 0 and 2*PI.
            new.getOrientation() == ((2*Math.PI) + (orientation % (2*Math.PI))) % 2* Math.PI

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Returns True if the unit is moving.
        Returns:
        True if the unit is moving, falling or following.
            result == this.getCurrentActivity() == this.getMoveActivity() ||
                      this.getCurrentActivity() == this.getFallActivity() ||
                      this.getCurrentActivity() == this.getFollowActivity()

      • moveToAdjacent

        public void moveToAdjacent(int dx,
                           int dy,
                           int dz)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           InvalidActionException,
                           InvalidPositionException
        Makes the unit move towards one of the adjacent cubes.
        Parameters:
        dx - the x direction
        dy - the y direction
        dz - the z direction
        Effects:
      • Set the moveActivity's target.
            this.getMoveActivity().updateAdjacent(dx, dy, dz)
      • Change the activity to MoveActivity.
            this.switchActivity(this.getMoveActivity())
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the dx, dy or dz values aren't -1, 0 or +1 | Math.abs(dx) > 1 || Math.abs(dy) > 1 || Math.abs(dz) > 1
        InvalidPositionException - If the target cube is not within the world bounds | !this.isValidPosition(this.getPosition().add(dx, dy, dz)) | || !this.isStablePosition(this.getPosition().add(dx, dy, dz))
        InvalidActionException

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(IntVector target)
            throws InvalidPositionException,
                   InvalidActionException,
                   UnreachableTargetException
        Starts the units movement to the given target cube.
        Parameters:
        target - The coordinates of the target cubes.
        Effects:
      • Change the moveActivity's target.
            this.getMoveActivity().updateTarget(target)
      • Change the current activity to MoveActivity.
            this.switchActivity(this.getMoveActivity())
        • Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - If the given target is not valid. | !isValidPosition(target[0], target[1], target[2])
        UnreachableTargetException - If the unit can't reach the target. | !this.getPathFinder().isReachable(this.getPosition().toIntVector(), target)
        InvalidActionException

      • follow

        public void follow(Unit other)
            throws InvalidActionException,
                   InvalidPositionException,
                   UnreachableTargetException,
                   InvalidUnitException
        Makes the current unit follow the given unit.
        Parameters:
        other - The unit to be followed.
        Effects:
      • Set the followActivity's other unit.
            this.getFollowActivity().setOther(other)
      • The current activity will be set to FollowActivity.
            this.switchActivity(this.getFollowActivity())
        • Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - Throws if the other's unit position is not a valid position. | !((getWorld().isValidPosition(cubePos)) && (!World.isSolid(world.getCubeType(cubePos))) || | (this.getWorld() == null))
        UnreachableTargetException - Throws if the position of the other unit is unreachable. | this.getPathFinder(this.getPosition().toIntVector(), target.toIntVector()) == null
        InvalidActionException
        InvalidUnitException

      • getSpeed

        @Basic
 @Model
Vector getSpeed()
        Returns the speed of the unit. (if the unit is sprinting, the speed is doubled)

      • setSpeed

        void setSpeed(Vector speed)
        Sets the speed of the unit to the given value.
        Parameters:
        speed - The value to set the speed to.
        Postcondition:
        The new speed of the unit will equal the given speed.
            new.getSpeed() == speed

      • getSpeedScalar

        public double getSpeedScalar()
        Gets the unit's movement speed.
        Returns:
        Returns the norm of the speed or zero if the speed is null.
            if (this.getSpeed() == null) then result == 0
            else result == this.getSpeed().norm()

      • isSprinting

        @Basic
public boolean isSprinting()
        Returns True if the unit is sprinting

      • setSprinting

        public void setSprinting(boolean newSprint)
                  throws InvalidActionException
        Sets sprinting to the given boolean.
        Parameters:
        newSprint - The boolean to set sprinting to.
        Postcondition:
        Sprinting will equal the given boolean
            new.isSprinting() == newSprint
        Throws:
        InvalidActionException - Thrown if the unit can't sprint | newSprint && (this.getStamina() == 0 || !this.isMoving() || this.isFalling())

      • isWorking

        public boolean isWorking()
        Returns True if the unit is working
        Returns:
        True if the unit is working.
            result == this.getCurrentActivity() == this.getWorkActivity()

      • workAt

        public void workAt(IntVector location)
            throws InvalidActionException,
                   InvalidPositionException
        The unit starts working at the given location.
        Postcondition:
        Makes the unit start working
            new.isWorking() == True
        Throws:
        InvalidActionException - Throws if the unit can't work. | (!canHaveAsActivity(WORK_ACTIVITY_CLASS)
        InvalidPositionException - Throws if the location is out of range | (Math.abs(diff.getX()) > 1 || Math.abs(diff.getY()) > 1 || Math.abs(diff.getZ()) > 1)
        InvalidPositionException - Throws if the location isn't valid. | !this.getWorld().isValidPosition(location)

      • dropCarry

        void dropCarry(IntVector workLoc)
        throws InvalidPositionException
        Makes the unit drop whatever it is carrying.
        Parameters:
        workLoc - The location to drop the object.
        Effect:
        If the unit is carrying a log, set it position to the workLoc and add it to the world.
            if (this.getCarryGameObject() != null) then
              ( this.getCarryGameObject().setPosition(workLoc.toVector().add(Terrain.Lc/2)) &&
                this.getWorld().addGameObject(this.getGameObject()) && this.setGameObject(null) )
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException

      • pickUpGameObject

        void pickUpGameObject(GameObject gb)
        Picks up the given log.
        Parameters:
        gb - The GameObject to pick up.
        Postcondition:
        The unit will carry the GameObject.
            new.getGameObject() == gb
        Effect:
        Remove the GameObject from the world.
            this.getWorld().removeGameObject(gb)

      • isAttacking

        public boolean isAttacking()
        Returns True if the unit is attacking.
        Returns:
        True if the unit is attacking.
            result == this.getCurrentActivity() == this.getAttackActivity()

      • attack

        public void attack(Unit other)
            throws InvalidActionException,
                   InvalidUnitException
        Attacks another unit.
        Parameters:
        other - The unit that is attacked by this unit.
        Postconditions:
      • Makes the units look at each other.
            new.getOrientation() == atan2((other.getPosition().getY() - this.getPosition().getY()),
                  (other.getPosition().getX() - this.getPosition().getX()))
            (new other).getOrientation() == atan2((this.getPosition().getY() - other.getPosition().getY()),
                  (this.getPosition().getX() - other.getPosition().getX()))
      • Makes the unit attack.
            new.isAttacking == True
        • Throws:
        InvalidUnitException - Throws if the other unit is null or if the unit tries to attack itself or if the other unit is falling | (other == null || other == this || other.getCurrentActivity.equalsClass(FALL_ACTIVITY_CLASS))
        InvalidActionException - Throws if the unit can't attack. | !this.canSwitchActivity()
        InvalidUnitException - Throws if the other unit is not in attack range. | (!this.canAttack(other))
        InvalidUnitException - Throws if the other unit is in the same faction. | (this.getFaction() == other.getFaction())

      • lookAt

        void lookAt(Vector other)
        Makes the unit face the other position.
        Parameters:
        other - The position to lookAt.
        Effect:
        Set the unit's orientation.
            this.setOrientation(Math.atan2( other.subtract(this.getPosition()).getY(),
                                            other.subtract(this.getPosition()).getX() ))

      • defend

        void defend(Unit attacker)
        Defends against another unit's attack.
        Parameters:
        attacker - The unit that attacks this unit.
        Effects:
      • If the unit is working or resting, interrupt the unit.
            if ( this.getCurrentActivity() == this.getWorkActivity() ||
                 this.switchActivity(this.getNoneActivity())
      • If the unit dodges the attack he jumps in the x and y direction both with a distance in range of -1 to 1 to a valid position. and the new position can not be equal to the original. The unit does not take any damage. The unit receives xp and the units look at each other.
            if (random < (0.20 * this.getAgility() / attacker.getAgility()))
              then ( this.addXp(20) &&
                     this.setPosition(this.getRandomDodgePosition()) &&
                     this.lookAt(attacker.getPosition() && attacker.lookAt(this.getPosition()) )           Else if the attack is blocked, the unit will not take any damage and will get xp.
            else if (random < (0.25 * (this.getStrength() + this.getAgility())/(other.getStrength() + other.getAgility())))
              then ( this.addXp(20) )           Else if the attack hit the unit, it will take damage equal to the attacker's strength/10 and the attackers receives xp.
            else
              ( this.deduceHitPoints(attacker.getStrength() / 10) && attacker.addXp(20) )

      • addXp

        void addXp(int xp)
        Adds the given xp to the xp counter and xp difference.
        Parameters:
        xp - The xp to add
        Postconditions:
      • The units xp will be increased with xp.
            new.getXp() == xp + this.getXp()
      • XpDiff will be increased with xp.
            new.getXpDiff() == xp + this.getXpDiff()

            this.setTracker(null)

              this.getAssignedTask().interrupt()
